meanings.sent1: I have one cookie, but I want the tother one.
meanings.sent2: She gave me one pencil, but I need the tother one too.
meanings.sent3: I asked for one toy, but my brother took the tother one!
meanings.sent4: The tother side of the river looked more peaceful and serene.
meanings.sent5: The tother option seemed more appealing and exciting.

meanings.definition: The second of two things mentioned
meanings.sent1: I have a red shirt and a blue one, but I prefer the tother.
meanings.sent2: He has two cars, but he always drives the tother one.
meanings.sent3: I bought one book, but I forgot to get the tother one!
meanings.sent4: The tother choice seemed more logical and practical.
meanings.sent5: The tother solution was simpler and more effective.
